Classes in be.belgium.eid.exceptions used by be.belgium.eid.eidcommon
TagNotFoundException
          The "tag not found" exception indicates that in a TLV mapping the given tag doesn't exist and as such cannot be used to identify data associated with it.
 

Classes in be.belgium.eid.exceptions used by be.belgium.eid.eidlib
CardNotFoundException
          The "card not found" exception indicates that the card with which the connection is to be made is not present in the card reader.
EIDException
          The eID exception concerns any BE ID specific exceptions.
InvalidSWException
          The "invalid SW" exception indicates that the values 0x90 and 0x00 should have been returned for Status Word (SW) 1 and 2 respectively.
NoReadersFoundException
          The "no readers found" exception indicates that in the current context (state of the device) there are no readers connected to the system or with that name.
WrongPINException
          The "wrong PIN" exception indicates that the entered PIN was invalid.
 

Classes in be.belgium.eid.exceptions used by be.belgium.eid.exceptions
CardNotFoundException.CardNotFoundType
          Contains the types of card not found exception
 

Classes in be.belgium.eid.exceptions used by be.belgium.eid.objects
BufferTooSmallException
          The "buffer too small" exception indicates that the requested data couldn't be stored in the given buffer since it was too small.
TagNotFoundException
          The "tag not found" exception indicates that in a TLV mapping the given tag doesn't exist and as such cannot be used to identify data associated with it.
 

Classes in be.belgium.eid.exceptions used by be.belgium.eid.security
CardNotFoundException
          The "card not found" exception indicates that the card with which the connection is to be made is not present in the card reader.
 

Classes in be.belgium.eid.exceptions used by be.belgium.eid.tests
TagNotFoundException
          The "tag not found" exception indicates that in a TLV mapping the given tag doesn't exist and as such cannot be used to identify data associated with it.
